channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for LA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for LA

item.title: Report X-2023081508
item.description:
Report X-2023081508

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-30T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-16
  • City: LIVONIA
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: I received a call that there was an odor emitting from a residue Butadiene car in Livonia LA. The car was isolated and discovered that the vapor valve was a quarter turn in the open position with the plug less than tool tight. The valve was closed, and the plug properly tightened, and the odor subsided. No further action was taken and the car release back into transportation.

item.title: Report X-2023080570
item.description:
Report X-2023080570

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-01
  • City: BATON ROUGE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Approx. around 6:15am Hazmat steel drum was found sitting on the belt line damaged. There was a small amount of spilled paint at the top of drum around cap. Steel drum was placed into a red hazardous tote and moved to hazmat cage for inspection. DescribePack: There was a small amount of paint spilled around the top of drum where cap is located. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Steel drum was placed into a red hazardous tote using proper eye and wear gear to transport to hazmat cage for inspection.

item.description:
Report E-2023080568

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-18
  • City: SHREVEPORT
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading the warehouse crew accidentally put a forklift fork into one of the poly 5 gallon pail of lacquer thinner (un1263) releasing 1 gallon of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report X-2023080492
item.description:
Report X-2023080492

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-24T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-27
  • City: COVINGTON
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package came off trailer from OLIV with side wall wet. Inspection reveal internal leakage. DescribePack: The seal underneath the cap corroded from the liquid causing it to leak past the cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in lined damaged hazmat tote and relocated to hazmat cage. No spillage found in trailer or on dock.

item.title: Report E-2023080169
item.description:
Report E-2023080169

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-08
  • City: SHREVEPORT
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading the warehouse crew accidentally put a forklift fork into one of the metal 55 gallon drums of araldire (un3082) releasing 5 gallons of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.
